Every piece of advanced technology is built on previous advances; for instance, digital cameras depend on microelectronics, optics, LED’s, CCD’s and advanced batteries (each one of which was it’s own impressive advance). However, given the frame of the question, I would vote for the satellite global positioning systems (GPS). To pull this off, you need to combine advanced technology in microelectronics, precision timekeeping, RF propagation, geodetics, rocketry, reliability, radiation hardness, battery technology, LED or LCD displays and materials technology. And it’s all the more impressive in that this technology has become massively and inexpensively available to everyone on Earth, becoming so ubiquitous that GPS is now just an assumed accessory for your smartphone.

Maybe not so advanced because it is actually fairly simple in concept, but my vote would go to the Intra Aortic Balloon Pump. It is a balloon catheter that is advanced into the aorta through the femoral artery. By getting a signal from the patients ECG, it inflates and deflates (40cc), in time with the hearts pumping cycle. For patients in heart failure, this increases the available oxygen for the heart muscle AND decreases the work the sick heart needs to perform in order to provide life sustaining circulation by about 15 percent. This factor has resulted in saving countless numbers of people's lives!!!! Kudos to whomever thought this through. The Cardiac Pacemaker is right up there too.

My apple iwatch! Having a gadget that makes u active through out the day and makes u actually stand up if u have been sitting for long is fun. Makes me more sure about my calories burned and i get more motivated. This watch also rewards me when i finish my goal. The watch is really cool and fun to work with, specially when i take calls like an agent or something! I would say its the coolest and easiest most common one these day.

The place where I actually see rapid technical advancement is in the medical field. Robotic assisted surgery is now commonplace. Yesterday I went for a long overdue mammogram at my local hospital and in 3 minutes they had located and ordered an image of my last one 8 years ago at another hospital in another state. My dentist takes a photo of a tooth with a hand held camera, and immediately we are looking at it on a large wall monitor as he reviews with me the exact procedure he will follow to replace a bad filling.

Thanks for A2A. What is the most amazing little-known technology in the world today? It’s a very little-known bacterium that has been found in the Pacific Trash Vortex. There’s been very little development at this point, because research is still in progress. This particular bacterium consumes plastic. Unless it’s ecologically dependent on the PTV environment, cultivating it and setting up huge vats of single-celled organisms that are destroying plastic at a molecular level will really help to clean up the planet.
